column4: Realty Income to buy commercial property landlord VEREIT for about $11 billion
column5: (Reuters) -Realty Income Corp said on Thursday it would buy commercial property landlord VEREIT Inc for about $11 billion and spin off office properties of both companies into a publicly traded REIT.
column6: VEREIT shareholders will receive 0.705 shares of Realty Income stock and will own 30% of the combined company, while Realty shareholders will own 70%.
column7: Realty Income expects the deal, likely to close during the fourth quarter of 2021, to result in over 10% accretion to its adjusted funds from operations per share in the first year.
column8: Moelis & Company LLC and Wells Fargo Securities are acting as financial advisers to Realty Income.
column9: J.P. Morgan Securities LLC is serving as the financial adviser to VEREIT.

column4: Realty Income to buy commercial property landlord VEREIT
column5: April 29 (Reuters) - Realty Income Corp said on Thursday it would buy commercial property landlord VEREIT Inc to create a combined company with an enterprise value of about $50 billion. (Reporting by Uday Sampath in Bengaluru; Editing by Bernard Orr)

column4: UPDATE 1-Cineworld to sell, leaseback some U.S. cinemas
column6: May 15 (Reuters) - British cinema operator Cineworld Group Plc said on Wednesday it signed a deal to sell and lease back U.S.-based multi-screen cinemas to units of Realty Income Corp.
column7: Cineworld will sell 17 cinemas for a cash consideration of $286.3 million and lease them back under 15-year leases.
column8: The company, which had bought U.S. cinema chain Regal Entertainment for $3.6 billion, said it was also in talks with a separate party for a sale and leaseback deal involving 18 multi-screen cinemas based in the United States.
column9: The terms of the deal will be similar to Cineworld’s deal with U.S.-based REIT Realty Income.
column10: Cineworld’s board will consider returning future proceeds in the form of a special dividend, once the deal is completed.
column11: The company said its plans to integrate Regal were on track.
column12: Separately, the cinema operator said its total revenue fell 9.4 percent on a pro-forma basis for the period between Jan. 1, 2019 and May 12, 2019. (Reporting by Tanvi Mehta in Bengaluru; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta and Rashmi Aich)

column4: British Land, Sainsbury sell 12 Superstores properties for $557 million
column5: (Reuters) - British Land Company Plc said on Tuesday it and joint venture partner Sainsbury Plc sold 12 Superstores properties to U.S.-based Realty Income Corp for 429 million pound ($556.9 million).
column6: British Land said its share of the proceeds from the disposal would be 193.5 million pounds and the portfolio represented a modest premium to the company’s September 2018 book value.
column7: The deal, expected to be completed in May, will reduce British Land’s Superstores exposure to 1.3 percent of its portfolio with six standalone stores remaining, it said.
column8: “We are focused on further sales of retail assets which are not aligned to our strategy and continue to make good progress,” British Land said.
column9: Realty Income Corp said separately that the deal was a long-term net lease agreement and marked the company’s first international real estate acquisition.
